intro: Arrhostoxylum inflatum, commonly known as the Andean flax or Andean lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs.
